metadata.Title: CVE-2019-0220 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
A vulnerability was found in Apache HTTP Server 2.4.0 to 2.4.38. When thepath component of a request URL contains multiple consecutive slashes('/'), directives such as LocationMatch and RewriteRule must account forduplicates in regular expressions while other aspects of the serversprocessing will implicitly collapse them.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-0220` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
apache2-bin - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
apache2-data - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
apache2-mpm-event - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
apache2-mpm-itk - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
apache2-mpm-prefork - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
apache2-mpm-worker - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
apache2-suexec - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
apache2-utils - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
apache2.2-bin - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
libapache2-mod-macro - 1:2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
libapache2-mod-proxy-html - 1:2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: apache2 package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22').
apache2 package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22').
